action.action-desc: Ms. Rosen introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To prohibit the Secretary of Energy from taking any action relating to the licensing, planning, development, or construction of a nuclear waste repository until the Director of the Office of Management and Budget submits to Congress a study on the economic viability and job-creating benefits of alternative uses of the Yucca Mountain site.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Jobs, Not Waste Act.

section.header: Studying the economic benefit of alternative uses of Yucca Mountain site

subsection.text: The Secretary of Energy may not take any action relating to the licensing, planning, development, or construction of a nuclear waste repository at the Yucca Mountain site until—

paragraph.text: the Director of the Office of Management and Budget submits to Congress, and makes available to the public, a study on the economic viability and job-creating benefits of alternative uses of the Yucca Mountain site as outlined in GAO Report 11–847, published on September 16, 2011, including—

subparagraph.text: defense activities, such as a command facility for unmanned aircraft systems;
the development of renewable energy sources; and

paragraph.text: Congress holds a hearing on the alternative uses under subparagraphs (A) through (D) of paragraph (1).

subsection.text: In this Act, the term Yucca Mountain site has the meaning given such term in section 2 of the Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982 (42 U.S.C. 10101).
